title: DataDuel
oneLiner: Fair fitness competition platform that scores runners based on personal improvement, not raw performance
overview: DataDuel is a web application that creates equitable running competitions by integrating with Strava and using a custom improvement-based scoring algorithm. Instead of rewarding raw athletic ability, the platform scores users based on progress relative to their personal baselines, consistency through streaks, and challenge completionâ€”ensuring beginners and elite runners can compete fairly.

stack.name: Vanilla JavaScript (ES6+)
stack.evidence: Frontend uses ES6 modules, no framework dependencies in package.json

stack.name: Strava API v3
stack.evidence: app.py implements OAuth flow, strava_parser.py processes activities

stack.name: Cloudflare Pages
stack.evidence: wrangler.toml configures deployment, DEPLOYMENT.md documents setup

stack.name: Render.com
stack.evidence: Procfile specifies deployment command, DEPLOYMENT.md documents backend setup

highlights: Designed and implemented improvement-based scoring algorithm that normalizes performance across fitness levels
Built complete OAuth 2.0 flow with Strava API including automatic token refresh and secure session management
Migrated from JSON file storage to Supabase PostgreSQL while maintaining backward compatibility
Created gamification system with automatic badge detection and weekly challenge tracking
Implemented friends system with bidirectional relationships and request workflow using Supabase
Built custom leagues feature allowing users to create private groups with separate leaderboards
Developed environment-aware frontend configuration that auto-detects development vs production
Created centralized authentication helper with automatic token refresh to handle session expiration
